title: Women's IPL on the Horizon: BCCI Plans Launch in 2023, Aiming for 5-6 Teams
content:
Get ready for a new era in Indian cricket! The Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is gearing up to launch the highly anticipated Women's IPL in 2023. 

BCCI president Sourav Ganguly confirmed the plans, stating that the initiative needs approval from the annual general meeting. IPL chairman Brijesh Patel added that a 5-6 team league is being envisioned, building upon the successful Women's T20 Challenge, which will feature four matches this year. 

This move comes as the BCCI is also preparing to put up the media rights for the men's IPL for the next five years. With a base price of around $4 billion, the lucrative league continues to be a major revenue generator for the BCCI, contributing significantly to the Indian economy.
author: AFP
